message.content:
{"id": "131649", "title": "Bug 131649 - Designer generates wrong column reference expression for inner table", 
"description": "This design uses a 2-level table to list offices and their employees. An incorrect expression is generated by the designer, which leads to the report failing to run. The correct behavior should be inserting rows[0][\"COUNTRY\"] into the expression when the user double clicks on \"COUNTRY\". The index number, 0, represents the nested table's index in the \"rows\" array.", 
"OB": "The designer is generating a wrong column reference expression for the inner table. When the user double clicks on the \"COUNTRY\" column, the expression should be modified to insert rows[0][\"COUNTRY\"] instead.", 
"EB": "The report designer should determine the correct index number by considering the nesting levels of all the tables.", 
"SR": "To reproduce this issue:\n1. Open the attached report design (test1.rptdesign).\n2. Double click on the inner list's Data Item to edit its expression.\n3. Click on \"Available Data Sets\" and select the \"offices\" data set.\n4. Double click on the \"COUNTRY\" column."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '131649', 'title': 'Bug 131649Designer generates wrong column reference expression for inner table', 'description': 'Bug 131649Designer generates wrong column reference expression for inner table This design uses a 2level table to list offices and their employees. So you can construct an expression like this:row["FIRSTNAME"] + " " + row["LASTNAME"] + " / " + row["OFFICECODE"]However this report will not run. So the correct behavior when the user double clicks on "COUNTRY" is to insertrows[0]["COUNTRY"]into the expression.The first index (an integer) to the "rows" array is the 0based index of the nested table which contains the data set (0 = outermost table, 1 = first level inner table etc.). ', 'OB': '', 'EB': 'The report designer should figure out the correct index number by looking at the nesting levels of all tables. ', 'SR': 'Open the attached report design (test1.rptdesign). To do this double click on the inner list\'s Data Item to edit its expression. Click on "Available Data Sets", choose data set "offices", then double click on column "COUNTRY". '}
